data.message: I have read all the reasons for connecting Messenger with FB you posted but, as a customer, I think I'll always have the last word so...making me switch between apps (fb-messenger) is irritating and a step back...full stop.

replies.message:
Hi Vangelis. We know it will take some time to adjust to using a second app, and we've tried to make it as convenient as possible: once you install Messenger, you'll still see message notifications in the Facebook app, in the same place where you're used to seeing them. Tapping the notification will take you into the Messenger app, and you can easily switch back and forth. 
-Chantal
Convenient is not splitting out the app needlessly and against your users wishes.
There are lots of other chat apps out there.  I'll be using those
Frankly, I have tried to think of the reason they would do this and can only come to the conclusion that they want to gain access to our tablets, phones, etc.
